iwork.eheap2
Class ACLManager

java.lang.Object
  iwork.eheap2.ACLManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventCallback
public class ACLManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventCallback

ACLManager is a utility class designed to aid application developers manage the handling of an application's access control lists. It also provides additional function calls to help in responding to acl-related-type query events.

Constructor Detail

ACLManager

public ACLManager(SecureEventHeap seh)
This class is the ACLManager, a utility class designed to facilitate handling of an application's Access Control Lists. Each application will need to create one instance of this class, and use its member functions to create and maintain the application's ACLs. The constructor of the class takes in a SecureEventHeap object, which is necessary because the ACLManager needs to get information regarding group membership, which is only available through the SecureEventHeap object.

Parameters:
seh - a SecureEventHeap object needed to get group membership info.
Method Detail

create

public boolean create(java.lang.String fileName,
                      java.lang.String ownerName)
Create a new file to store an application's ACLs. If the file already exist, it will be overwritten. The file is loaded by default after creation.

Parameters:
fileName - a String value
ownerName - a String denoting the owner
Returns:
a boolean true if success, fail otherwise

load

public boolean load(java.lang.String fileName)
Load a file to store ACL info. If fileName doesn't exist, operation will fail.

Parameters:
fileName - a String value
Returns:
a boolean value

save

public void save()
Save the ACL info currently loaded into the fileName originally specified for the load function.

registerACL

public void registerACL(java.lang.String aclName)
                 throws EventHeapException
Register a new ACL. Each ACL must be uniquely identified by a String.

Parameters:
aclName - a unique String identifying the ACL
Throws:
EventHeapException

addGroup

public void addGroup(java.lang.String aclName,
                     java.lang.String groupName,
                     java.util.Date expiry,
                     boolean delegate)
              throws EventHeapException
Adds a trust group to the ACL. All members of this TG are now automatically included in the ACL. If the group is already in the ACL, nothing will happen. (considered success)

Parameters:
aclName - a unique String identifying the ACL
expiry - expiration date of membership, can be null
delegate - whether the group can delegate this permission to others
Throws:
EventHeapException

addUser

public void addUser(java.lang.String aclName,
                    java.lang.String userName,
                    java.util.Date expiry,
                    boolean delegate)
             throws EventHeapException
Adds a user to the ACL. If user is already in ACL, nothing will happen. (considered success)

Parameters:
aclName - a unique String identifying the ACL
userName - username to be added to ACL.
expiry - expiration date of membership, can be null
delegate - whether the user can delegate this permission to others
Throws:
EventHeapException

removeGroup

public void removeGroup(java.lang.String aclName,
                        java.lang.String groupName,
                        boolean delegateOnly)
                 throws EventHeapException
Remove a trust group from the ACL. If the trust group is not in the ACL specified, nothing will happen. (considered success)

Parameters:
aclName - a unique String identifying the ACL
groupName - the trust group name to be removed
delegateOnly - whether to remove group's delegation power only (if set to true), or remove the group from the list totally (if set to false)
Throws:
EventHeapException

removeUser

public void removeUser(java.lang.String aclName,
                       java.lang.String userName,
                       boolean delegateOnly)
                throws EventHeapException
Remove a user from the ACL. If the user in not in the ACL specified, nothing will happen. (considered success)

Parameters:
aclName - a unique String identifying the ACL
userName - username to be removed from ACL.
delegateOnly - whether to remove user's delegation power only (if set to true), or remove the user from the list totally (if set to false)
Throws:
EventHeapException

                           java.lang.String userName)
                    throws EventHeapException
Checks if a particular user is in a given ACL.

Parameters:
aclName - a unique String identifying the ACL
userName - username whose membership is to be checked.

sendACL_CONTENTS

public void sendACL_CONTENTS(java.lang.String userName,
                             java.lang.String aclName)
                      throws EventHeapException
Send the contents (list of users and groups) of a given ACLName. Only owner and users with delegate permission can invoke sending of this type of event.

Parameters:
aclName - a String value
Throws:
EventHeapException - if an error occurs

sendGRANT_ACLNAMES

public void sendGRANT_ACLNAMES(java.lang.String userName,
                               boolean granted)
                        throws EventHeapException
Send a list of ACLNames that a given userName has access to. If granted it true, then send those that have been granted to user If granted is false, then send those that have been delegated to user

Parameters:
userName - a String identifying the user
granted - a boolean value
Throws:
EventHeapException - if an error occurs

This is the callback function that will be called when query events are sent to the server. Only works if autoReply is turned on.

Specified by:

Parameters:
